sect2.title: Introduction à libungif
sect2.para: The libungif package contains libraries for reading all GIFs and writing non-compressed ones as well as programs for converting and working with GIF files. The libraries are useful for any graphics program wishing to deal with GIF files while the programs are useful for conversion purposes as well as cleaning up images.

The reason libungif only writes non-compressed GIFs is due to a legal issue with LZW compression (which Unisys claims a patent on). Reading GIFs is not a problem as the decompression routines do not seem to be limited in this way. Note that this has in the past been disputed. The best way to avoid this whole mess is to simply use libungif for looking at GIF images on the web, while in any pages which you design, use the open source PNG format instead (which uses, not surprisingly, the libpng library) which has no patent issues at all.

sect2.title: Contenu
sect2.para: The libungif package contains gif2epsn, gif2ps, gif2rgb, gif2x11, gifasm, gifbg, gifburst, gifclip, gifclrmp, gifcolor, gifcomb, gifcompose, giffiltr, giffix, gifflip, gifhisto, gifinfo, gifinter, gifinto, gifovly, gifpos, gifrotat, gifrsize, gifspnge, giftext, gifwedge, icon2gif, raw2gif, rgb2gif, text2gif and libungif libraries.

sect3.title: gif2epsn
sect3.para: Dumps images saved as GIF files on Epson type printers.

sect3.title: gif2ps
sect3.para: Print GIF files on laser printers supporting PostScript.

sect3.title: gif2rgb
sect3.para: Convert images saved as GIF to 24-bit RGB image(s).

sect3.title: gif2x11
sect3.para: Display images saved as GIF files under X Window System.

sect3.title: gifasm
sect3.para: Assemble multiple GIFs into one, or burst a multiple-image GIF.

sect3.title: gifbg
sect3.para: Generate a single-color test pattern GIF.

sect3.title: gifburst
sect3.para: Burst a GIF image into subrectangles.

sect3.title: gifclip
sect3.para: Clip or crop a GIF image.

sect3.title: gifclrmp
sect3.para: Modify GIF image colormaps.

sect3.title: gifcolor
sect3.para: Generate color test patterns.

sect3.title: gifcomb
sect3.para: Combine 2 GIF images of exactly the same size into one.

sect3.title: gifcompose
sect3.para: Use (un)giflib tools to compose images.

sect3.title: giffiltr
sect3.para: Template code for filtering a GIF sequentially.

sect3.title: giffix
sect3.para: Clumsily attempts to fix truncated GIF images.

sect3.title: gifflip
sect3.para: Flip GIF image along X or Y axis or rotate by 90 degrees.

sect3.title: gifhisto
sect3.para: Generate color-frequency histogram from a GIF.

sect3.title: gifinfo
sect3.para: Gives information on a GIF file.

sect3.title: gifinter
sect3.para: Convert between interlaced and non-interlaced images.

sect3.title: gifinto
sect3.para: End-of-pipe fitting for GIF-processing pipelines.

sect3.title: gifovly
sect3.para: Generate one composite GIF from a multiple-image GIF.

sect3.title: gifpos
sect3.para: Change a GIF's screen size or recondition it.

sect3.title: gifrotat
sect3.para: Rotate a GIF through any desired angle.

sect3.title: gifrsize
sect3.para: Resize a GIF by deletion or duplication of bits.

sect3.title: gifspnge
sect3.para: Template code for filtering a GIF with in-core operations.

sect3.title: giftext
sect3.para: Print (text only) general information about a GIF.

sect3.title: gifwedge
sect3.para: Create a test GIF image resembling a color monitor test pattern.

sect3.title: icon2gif
sect3.para: Converter/deconverter to/from an editable text format.

sect3.title: raw2gif
sect3.para: Convert raw 8-bit image data into GIF files.

sect3.title: rgb2gif
sect3.para: Convert 24 bit images to a GIF image using color quantization.

sect3.title: text2gif
sect3.para: Generate GIF images out of regular text in 8x8 font.
